_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.0  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at Morningstar Foods Inc.

Morningstar Foods prevents accidental releases through classroom and on the job training of refrigeration personnel and ongoing inspection and maintenance of the refrigeration system.  Wherever possible refrigeration system components are located in areas that are not as likely to become damaged (i.e., tanks and pipe runs are placed away and protected from forklift and truck traffic). The facility maintains an ongoing emergency response program that prepares for safe evacuation and timely response by trained personnel.

2.0 Morningstar Foods and Anhydrous Ammonia.

Morningstar Foods processes and cools milk, cream and soy products for national distribution. Approximately 14,000 lbs. of anhydrous ammonia is contained within the refrigeration system on site at Morningstar Foods. A Risk Management Plan has been developed as required and is maintained in order to reduce the possibility of an accidental release of ammonia from the system. 

3.0  Accidental Release Prevention Program and Prevention Steps.

Morningstar Foods complies with all rules and regulations that pertain to the safe storage and use of anhydrous ammonia. Specific regulations include: OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM) rule; OSHA Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER); OSHA Hazard Communication (HAZCOM); OSHA Employee Emergency Plans and Fire Prevention Plans; EPA Risk Management Plans (RMP). 

Specific prevention steps that have been implemented to increase the safety of operation of the ammonia refrigeration system include: Two (2) emergency shut down push buttons are installed, enabling remote shutdown of the ammonia refrigeration system; the ammonia system is inspected daily; ammonia detectors are installed in the coolers and engine room; all refrigeration service valves have identification tags; security fencing has been installed around the facility; security personnel are on site

24 hours, 7 days per week.

4.0  Five Year Accident History.

There has not been any reportable accidents, associated with the ammonia refrigeration system, as defined by 40 CFR Part 68, at Morningstar Foods in the last five years. There is a record of a release incident maintained on file as part of the facility Process Safety Management Program.

5.0  Morningstar Foods Emergency Response Program.

Morningstar Foods maintains an ongoing emergency response program in order to efficiently notify and evacuate employees, notify potential critical receptors in the community and state and local emergency response agencies. The program includes initial and annual training for employees who respond to releases or potential releases. The program includes written procedures for proper first aid and emergency medical treatment to treat human exposures; procedures for using emergency response equipment and procedures to review and update the plan and ensure that employees are informed of changes. The facility emergency response plan is coordinated with the local fire department as required by the Emergency Planning and Community Right to Know Act.

6.0  Planned Changes to Improve Safety at Morningstar Foods.

Future plans to improve anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system safety at the Morningstar Foods facility consists of continuing annual operator training, periodic Process Safety Management Program audits, and continuing management of the facility PSM program elements.
